subject: Medicine
title: White Blood Cells on Patrol
description: A micro-lesson that makes White Blood Cells on Patrol usable.

hook.text: For every 700 red blood cells, there is one white one.

buildup.text: White blood cells roam the bloodstream hunting invaders.

discovery.text: Some swallow bacteria whole like tiny predators.

twist.text: Pus is actually a pile of dead white blood cells.

climax.text: They sacrifice themselves to protect the body.

quiz.question: What is pus mainly composed of?
